list.title: Vue.js
list.content: Vue (pronounced /vjuÀê/, like view) is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Unlike other monolithic frameworks, Vue is designed from the ground up to be incrementally adoptable. The core library is focused on the view layer only, and is easy to pick up and integrate with other libraries or existing projects.

list.title: Vue.js Server-Side Rendering
list.content: Vue.js is a framework for building client-side applications. By default, Vue components produce and manipulate DOM in the browser as output. However, it is also possible to render the same components into HTML strings on the server, send them directly to the browser, and finally 'hydrate' the static markup into a fully interactive app on the client.

list.title: The official router for Vue.js.
list.content: Vue Router is the official router for Vue.js. It deeply integrates with Vue.js core to make building Single Page Applications with Vue.js a breeze.

list.title: Vue.js Server-Side Rendering
list.content: Vue.js is a framework for building client-side applications. By default, Vue components produce and manipulate DOM in the browser as output. list.title: Centralized State Management for Vue.js.
list.content: Vuex is a state management pattern + library for Vue.js applications. It serves as a centralized store for all the components in an application, with rules ensuring that the state can only be mutated in a predictable fashion.
